case_title: FAZAL ILAHI vs Malik MUZAFFAR HUSSAIN
complaint_summary: The appellant challenged his transfer order from Government High School, Kakrali to Government High School, Kohar, citing frequent transfers within one calendar year.
investigation_summary: The District Education Officer reported that the appellant was indulging in local politics in his home village Kakrali, which led to complaints and his transfer to Kohar.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal found the transfer order plausible and dismissed the appeal, stating that the transfer was not attended by extraordinary circumstances.
legal_arguments: Transfer of a government servant is a normal incident of service.
No extraordinary circumstances warrant interference with the transfer order.
Complaints about indulging in local politics were credible.
key_issues: Frequent transfers within one calendar year
Discretion of competent authority in transfer orders

legal_terms.Transfer Order: An administrative action relocating a government employee to a different workplace.
legal_terms.In Limine: Dismissal of a case at the outset without a full hearing.

words_and_phrases.Local Politics: Engagement in political activities within one's local community.
words_and_phrases.Bradri: A term referring to a social group or clan.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves the dismissal of an appeal against a transfer order of a government teacher due to allegations of indulging in local politics. The Tribunal upheld the transfer as a normal administrative action without extraordinary circumstances.
